io.hekate.rpc

Class RpcClientConfig

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.hekate.rpc.RpcClientConfig

  • public class RpcClientConfig
extends Object
    RPC client configuration.

    This class provides support for pre-configuring some of the RpcClientBuilder's options. When RpcClientBuilder is requested from the RpcService it first searches for an existing configuration by using the following rules:

    • if RpcService.clientFor(Class) method is used then it will search for an instance of RpcClientConfig that has the same RPC interface and a null tag
    • if RpcService.clientFor(Class, String) method is used then it will search for an instance of RpcClientConfig that has the same RPC interface and the same tag value

    If such RpcClientConfig instance is found then its options will be applied to the RpcClientBuilder.

    For more details about the Remote Procedure Call API and its capabilities please see the documentation of the RpcService interface.

    See Also:
    RpcService.clientFor(Class), RpcService.clientFor(Class, String)

        public void setRpcInterface(Class<?> rpcInterface)
        Sets the RPC interface.

        The specified interface must be public and must be annotated with Rpc.

        Parameters:
        rpcInterface - RPC interface.

      • getTag

        public String getTag()
        Returns the RPC interface tag (see setTag(String)).
        Returns:
        RPC interface tag.

      • setTag

        public void setTag(String tag)
        Sets the RPC interface tag.

        If this parameter is specified then RPC requests will be submitted only to those servers that have the same tag set via RpcServerConfig.setTags(Set). If this parameter is not specified then client will be able to submit RPC requests only to those servers that don't have any tags too.

        Parameters:
        tag - RPC interface tag.
        See Also:
        RpcServerConfig.setTags(Set), RpcService.clientFor(Class, String)

      • setTimeout

        public void setTimeout(long timeout)
        Sets the RPC timeout in milliseconds.

        If the RPC operation can not be completed at the specified timeout then such operation will end up an error. Specifying a negative or zero value disables the timeout check.

        Parameters:
        timeout - RPC timeout in milliseconds.
        See Also:
        RpcClientBuilder.withTimeout(long, TimeUnit)
